definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"
to use/to employ/to have to/to eat or drink/expense or outlay/usefulness/hence/therefore

sentences.english: And light multitaskers might be better at preserving their attention.
sentences.chinese: 并且轻度的一心多用者可能更擅长保持注意力。

sentences.english: But new science suggests it's not always a winning game.
sentences.chinese: 但新的科学认为一心多用不一定总是给人们带来好处。

sentences.english: Actually, multitasking can make you perform worse in whatever you're doing.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，一心多用会让你不论做什么都做得更差。

sentences.english: Why are there so few great multitaskers?
sentences.chinese: 为什么善于一心多用的人这么少？

sentences.english: Is reading in the bathroom considered multi-tasking?
sentences.chinese: 上厕所时读书能不能叫做一心多用呢？

sentences.english: But science suggests that multitasking as we know it is a myth.
sentences.chinese: 但科学显示我们所知的一心多用只是个神话。

sentences.english: An entire class of technologies is dedicated to the furtherance of multitasking.
sentences.chinese: 有一整套的技术专门用来促进一心多用。

sentences.english: And you say there’s a biological explanation for why we love to multitask.
sentences.chinese: 您说对于人们喜欢一心多用有生物学方面的原因？

sentences.english: So what's actually going on is your brain is switching back and forth between the different tasks.
sentences.chinese: 所以一心多用其实只是在不同的任务之间快速转换。

sentences.english: And if haste is the accelerator pedal, multitasking is overdrive.
sentences.chinese: 如果匆忙是加速器的踏板，一心多用就是超速档。

sentences.english: There are exceptions to this, and there are people who are exceptional at multi-tasking.
sentences.chinese: 不过也有例外，有些人是特变擅长”一心多用“。

definition: to do two things at once (idiom)/to multitask/to divide one's attention
to be absent-minded/to desert/to abscond from the army/absent without leave (AWOL)
lit. the eyes watch six roads and the ears listen in all directions/to be observant and alert (idiom)
pinyin: yan3 guan1 liu4 lu4 er3 ting1 ba1 fang1

definition: to give attention to sth/please give (some of your valuable) attention to my task/to be distracted
to concentrate one's attention/to be fully focused
to operate (a machine etc) with ease
to bite off more than one can chew (idiom)
